previous.name: The Finest Lady in the Land

segments.pli: saddhā, bhikkhave, upāsikā ekaputtakaṃ piyaṃ manāpaṃ evaṃ sammā āyācamānā āyāceyya:
segments.en: A faithful laywoman with a dear and beloved only son would rightly appeal to him,

segments.pli: ‘tādiso, tāta, bhavāhi yādiso citto ca gahapati hatthako ca āḷavako’ti.
segments.en: ‘My darling, please be like the householder Citta and Hatthaka of Aḷavī.’

segments.pli: Esā, bhikkhave, tulā etaṃ pamāṇaṃ mama sāvakānaṃ upāsakānaṃ, yadidaṃ citto ca gahapati hatthako ca āḷavako.
segments.en: These are a standard and a measure for my male lay disciples, that is, the householder Citta and Hatthaka of Aḷavī.

segments.pli: Sace kho tvaṃ, tāta, agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajasi;
segments.en: ‘But my darling, if you go forth from the lay life to homelessness,
please be like Sāriputta and Moggallāna.’

segments.pli: Esā, bhikkhave, tulā etaṃ pamāṇaṃ mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, yadidaṃ sāriputtamoggalānā.
segments.en: These are a standard and a measure for my monk disciples, that is, Sāriputta and Moggallāna.

segments.pli: Mā ca kho tvaṃ, tāta, sekhaṃ appattamānasaṃ lābhasakkārasiloko anupāpuṇātūti.
segments.en: ‘And my darling, may you not come into possessions, honor, and popularity while you’re still a trainee and haven’t achieved your heart’s desire.’

segments.pli: Tañce, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṃ sekhaṃ appattamānasaṃ lābhasakkārasiloko anupāpuṇāti, so tassa hoti antarāyāya.
segments.en: If a trainee who hasn’t achieved their heart’s desire comes into possessions, honor, and popularity it’s an obstacle for them.

segments.pli: Evaṃ dāruṇo kho, bhikkhave, lābhasakkārasiloko … pe …
segments.en: So brutal are possessions, honor, and popularity. …”

suttaplex.blurb: A laywoman should wish that if her son remains in the household life, he should be like Citta and Hatthaka. But if he becomes a monk, may material possessions, honor, and praise not come to him!
